Class Boss

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
com.example.demo.Entities.ActiveActor
com.example.demo.Entities.ActiveActorDestructible
com.example.demo.Entities.FighterPlane
com.example.demo.Entities.Boss
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Boss extends FighterPlane
Represents the Boss entity in the game, inheriting from FighterPlane. The boss has a movement pattern, can toggle its shield, and fire projectiles.

  • Property Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Boss

      public Boss()
      Initializes the Boss entity with default properties, such as movement pattern, health, and shield. The boss's shield is initially inactive, and the movement pattern is randomized.

  • Method Details

    • setLevelView

      public void setLevelView(LevelBoss_Interface levelView)
      Sets the LevelBoss_Interface for interaction with the level.
      Parameters:
      levelView - The level interface that allows interaction with the boss in the context of the game level.

    • setParentPane

      public void setParentPane(javafx.scene.Parent parentPane)
      Sets the parent pane for managing visibility and interactions with the game scene.
      Parameters:
      parentPane - The parent pane where the boss and shield indicator will be displayed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided parentPane is not of type Pane.

    • updateActor

      public void updateActor()
      Updates the boss actor's state, including its position, shield, and other behaviors.
      Specified by:
      updateActor in class ActiveActorDestructible

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the boss's position based on its movement pattern, ensuring it doesn't move out of bounds.
      Specified by:
      updatePosition in class ActiveActorDestructible

    • fireProjectile

      public ActiveActorDestructible fireProjectile(UserPlane userPlane)
      Fires a projectile at the player's plane if the firing conditions are met.
      Overrides:
      fireProjectile in class FighterPlane
      Parameters:
      userPlane - The user's plane, which is the target for the projectile.
      Returns:
      A new BossProjectile if the boss fires, or null if it does not.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage()
      Reduces the boss's health when it takes damage. If the shield is active, damage is prevented.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Destructible
      Overrides:
      takeDamage in class FighterPlane

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      Gets the maximum health of the boss.
      Returns:
      The maximum health value for the boss.

    • initializeMovePattern

      private void initializeMovePattern()
      Initializes the movement pattern for the boss. The pattern alternates between moving up, down, and staying still. The pattern is shuffled to introduce randomness.

    • shouldFireProjectile

      private boolean shouldFireProjectile()
      Determines whether the boss should fire a projectile based on a random chance.
      Returns:
      True if the boss should fire, false otherwise.

    • getNextMove

      private int getNextMove()
      Gets the next vertical movement value from the boss's move pattern.
      Returns:
      The vertical movement value (positive, negative, or zero).

    • updateShieldState

      private void updateShieldState()
      Toggles the shield's state at random intervals, activating or deactivating it.

    • initializeShieldIndicator

      private void initializeShieldIndicator()
      Initializes the visual shield indicator that shows the current state of the shield. This includes a rectangle and text label that will be displayed in the UI.

    • updateShieldIndicator

      private void updateShieldIndicator()
      Updates the shield indicator to reflect the current shield state (ON or OFF).
